isis.stitle: CAB: 4100, 4200, 4300 AND 4400 MODELS - REMOVE - CAB DOOR VENT WINDOW

svcsubproc.title: Remove Front Cab Door Vent Window on Standard Cab, Extended Cab and Crew Cab for all Models

figure.caption: Figure 76. Front Cab Door Vent Window

calloutgroup.callout1: 5. UPPER CAB DOOR VENT WINDOW HINGE
6. UPPER CAB DOOR VENT WINDOW MOUNTING PIN
7. LOWER CAB DOOR VENT WINDOW MOUNTING PIN
8. LOWER CAB DOOR VENT WINDOW HINGE

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 76 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Open front cab door vent window (Item 1). Remove two torx head screws (Item 2) from vent window latch pivot (Item 3) and cab door vent window frame (Item 4), driver side shown.

With front cab door vent window (Item 1) still open, swing it out away from cab door vent window opening until the upper cab door vent window hinge (Item 5, View in Circle A) is accessible. Use a flat blade screw driver and carefully push the upper cab door vent window hinge up off the upper cab door vent window mounting pin (Item 6, View in Circle A). Once the cab door vent window is free at the top, lift lower cab door vent window mounting pin (Item 7, View in Circle B) out of the lower cab door vent window hinge (Item 8, View in Circle B) and remove from front cab door (Item 9), driver side shown. Lay it out of the way and save for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side front cab door vent window.
